subject: Personal Finance
title: Lifestyle Inflation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Lifestyle Inflation.

hook.text: You got a 30% raise. A year later you have the same amount in savings. Where did it go?

buildup.text: Lifestyle inflation means expenses rise in lockstep with income. More money in, more money out.

discovery.text: It's driven by social expectations. A promotion 'deserves' a nicer car, apartment, and wardrobe.

twist.text: Someone earning $200K with $190K in expenses is financially weaker than someone earning $60K saving $15K.

climax.text: The gap between income and spending â€” the savings rate â€” matters far more than income alone.

punchline.text: Rising income only helps if spending doesn't rise faster.

quiz.question: What is lifestyle inflation?
options: Expenses rising in proportion to income increases
The cost of living going up
